ETYMOLOGY: From Latin harēna 'sand, sandy place', originally the sand-covered central area of a Roman amphitheater where gladiators fought.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A level area in the center of an amphitheater, stadium, or other sporting venue where contests or spectacles are held.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 圆形剧场、体育场或其他体育场所中央的平坦区域，用于举办比赛或表演。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The concert will be held in the main arena of the stadium.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 音乐会将在体育场的主竞技场举行。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A sphere of conflict, activity, or competition.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 冲突、活动或竞争的领域或场所。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He felt unprepared for the cutthroat political arena.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他觉得自己还没有准备好应对残酷的政治舞台。
